definition: dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: For years my wife has loved to cook vegetarian meals.
sentences.chinese: 我妻子这些年一直喜欢做素菜。

sentences.english: Chop and freeze veggies such as onions and peppers, too.
sentences.chinese: 素菜也要剁好并冷冻，比如洋葱和辣椒。

sentences.english: We have a very nice vegetable today. It’s our chef’s recommendation.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天有一道非常好的素菜，是厨师的主推菜。

sentences.english: All fresh vegetables, with no exception, contain some vitamin C.
sentences.chinese: 所有新鲜素菜无一例外都含有维生素C。

sentences.english: Are there any vegetarian restaurants in Taipei?
The dishes are divided into two types, meat dish and vegetable dish .
sentences.chinese: 通常一道肉类和素菜有一个主色和两至三个对比色。

sentences.english: Pork, Beef, Chicken, Shrimp or Vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 叉烧，牛肉，鸡肉，鲜虾或素菜。

sentences.english: Mixed Vegetable can be use instead of tofu.
sentences.chinese: 选用杂菜取代豆腐亦是一道色香味全的素菜。

sentences.english: There are vegetarian, meat and seafood casseroles. All different choices are available to meet your appetite.
sentences.chinese: 有纯素菜煲，亦有肉类及海鲜煲，任君选择。

sentences.english: No, I have been at Tossed Healthy Green salad.
sentences.chinese: 不了，我已经点了健康素菜沙律。

sentences.english: So the guard took away their choice food and the wine they were to drink and gave them vegetables instead.
sentences.chinese: 于是委办撤去派他们用的膳，饮的酒，给他们素菜吃。

sentences.english: This vegetarian restaurant serves various dishes free from cholesterol.
sentences.chinese: 本素菜馆的菜肴，具有各种风味，不含任何胆固醇。

sentences.english: Thus Melzar took away the portion of their meat, and the wine that they should drink; and gave them pulse.
sentences.chinese: 于是委办撤去派他们用的膳，饮的酒，给他们素菜吃。

sentences.english: We have a very nice vegetable today.It’s our chef’s recommendation.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天有一道非常好的素菜，是厨师的主推菜。

definition: non-vegetarian dish (including meat, fish, garlic, onion etc)
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
appetizer/small side dish/easy job/piece of cake/see also 小菜一碟[xiao3 cai4 yi1 die2]
to smell, look and taste great
